Press the next arrow to start the flashcards :)
What is the process by which plants make their own food?
Photosynthesis
Which part of the plant absorbs water and nutrients from the soil?
Roots
What is the tallest species of tree in the world?
Coast Redwood
Which part of the plant is responsible for photosynthesis?
Leaves
What gas do plants absorb from the atmosphere for photosynthesis?
Carbon dioxide
What is the name of the reproductive structure of a plant?
Flower
Which plant is known for having large leaves that float on water?
Water lily
What type of plant grows in dry, desert environments?
Cactus
What is the term for a plant that lives for more than two years?
Perennial
Which flowering plant is known for its pleasant fragrance and is often used in perfumes?
Lavender
